meanings.definition: To make smaller in amount or degree.
meanings.sent1: Eating less candy can lessen the chance of getting cavities.
meanings.sent2: I hope the rain will lessen so we can go outside to play.
meanings.sent3: Trying to carry less books in your backpack will lessen the weight on your shoulders.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to lessen the sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise can lessen the fear of making mistakes.

meanings.definition: To decrease in intensity or severity.
meanings.sent1: Taking medicine can help lessen the pain in your throat.
meanings.sent2: The storm is starting to lessen, so it should be safer to go outside soon.
meanings.sent3: Wearing sunglasses can lessen the brightness of the sun on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: His apology seemed to lessen the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of laughter can lessen the feeling of loneliness.
